titleStmt.title: By the Queene. Whereas the Queenes Maiestie our most gratious soueraigne Ladie, by reason of the plague and pestilence, aswell in the citie of London, as in the citie of Westminster, did lately by her highnes proclamation adiourne part of the tearme of Saint Michael . . .
Proclamations. 1578-10-20
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I)
Elizabeth I, Queen of England, 1533-1603.

titleStmt.title: By the Queene. Whereas the Queenes Maiestie our most gratious soueraigne Ladie, by reason of the plague and pestilence, aswell in the citie of London, as in the citie of Westminster, did lately by her highnes proclamation adiourne part of the tearme of Saint Michael . . .

publicationStmt.publisher: By Christopher Barker, printer to the Queenes Maiestie [i.e. B. Norton and J. Bill],

notesStmt.note: Michaelmas Term is adjourned further because of plague.
